Dear Ms. Calcaterra:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A couple of months ago, a staff member contacted a youth and
their friend via Snapchat. The staff member shared nude photo's
with the youth and the youth's friend via Snapchat.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator provided an Agency Response Plan via email
on March 10, 2025, and a face-to-face meeting occurred at the
facility on May 12, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Administrator did not have any additional information to provide.
Youth was interviewed via telephone on May 15, 2025. Youth
initially did not want to talk, however, agreed to a short interview.
Youth said she has had to be at Children's Village twice. Youth
denied that she remembers ever seeing Staff 1 the first time that
she was at Children's Village. Youth reported the individual she
was talking to on Snapchat told her that they were a firefighter and
lived in Waterford and she is unsure if it was Staff 1. Youth said
she initially thought it was Staff 1 because of the gray spot in his
hair but is not sure whether the picture on Snapchat was gray hair,
a bald spot, or bleach. Youth denied Staff 1 working with her
directly at any time when she was at Children's Village.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face on May 12, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said he is a Youth
2

Specialist 2 and has been assigned to midnight shift control center
for the past ten years. Staff 1 said working in the control center he
does not have contact with the youth. Staff 1 said he has worked
early or additional shifts at times with the youth, however said he
always lets the staff that work the units take lead and he helps out
where needed since the youth do not have any relationship with
him. Staff 1 said he has worked with Law Enforcement and is
aware of the allegations. Staff 1 said he reported early to work on
March 7, 2025, and was in the same room as Youth from
approximately 7:30pm until 8:30pm. Staff 1 said he then moved to
his control center location and completed his midnight shift. Staff 1
said the following day at approximately 1:30pm he was called at
home and told he was being “put off” and that someone is going to
contact him on Monday with additional information. Staff 1 said he
has never snapchatted with any youth or had any social media
contact with youth. Staff 1 denied ever sending any naked pictures
to anyone including Youth.
Supervisor A was interviewed via telephone on May 13, 2025,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor A said he has
been a supervisor for Staff 1 for “a very long time”. Supervisor A
said he has never had any concerns about Staff 1’s behaviors or
interactions with the youth. Supervisor A said Staff 1’s interactions
with any youth would be very minimal as he works in the control
room and not on the units.
Supervisor B was interviewed via telephone on May 13, 2025,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor B said he is a
supervisor for Staff 1 and does not have any concerns with his
work performance or interactions with youth. Supervisor B said
Staff 1 has picked up shifts on the units with youth however
always takes a “backseat” to the other staff as he does not have
relationships with the youth. Supervisor B said working in the
control room Staff 1 would have very limited interactions with the
youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Waterford Police Department Case Report with incident
date of March 8, 2025. The police report outlines the
investigation of the allegations with a result of no findings.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed annual trainings as required.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, and review of the police report there is no evidence
that Staff 1 had any Snapchat contact with Youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130 Privacy and confidentiality
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff sent youth information to another staff on personal devices.
Investigation Interviews:
Law Enforcement phone contact occurred on April 4, 2025,
and email contact on May 5, 2025. Law Enforcement reported
that Staff 2 sent confidential information regarding Youth to Staff 1
on his personal phone. Law Enforcement said the information
included a log entry and photo of Youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face on May 12, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said he was called at
home and told he was being “put off” and that someone is going to
contact him on Monday with additional information. Staff 1 said
Staff 2 text him and ask him what was going on and he said he did
not know. Staff 1 said Staff 2 “looked into it” and sent him a photo
of the logbook that had an entry that a female youth made a
comment about the allegations that he had snapchatted with
Youth. Staff 1 said Staff 2 provided Youth’s name and a picture of
Youth. Staff 1 denied asking Staff 2 for the information, stating she
had just taken it upon herself to send it to him without him asking.
Staff 1 said he is unsure of the exact policy regarding this however
said “it is probably not allowed”.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on May 22, 2025. Staff 2
confirmed that she sent Youth’s photo, birthday, and a log entry of
another youth to Staff 1 from her personal cell phone. Staff 2 said
she was aware of the Confidentially Policy. Staff 2 said this was
poor judgement on her part.
Documents Reviewed:
• Oakland County Children’s Village Confidentiality policy
was reviewed. The policy states “Policy forbids the
unauthorized disclosure of confidential information about
any current or former resident of Children’s Village and/or
their family members. A “Disclosure” is defined as any act,
verbal or written, or the conveyance of any documents or
copies of documents, pertaining to residents and their
families; even the act of acknowledging or disclosing in any
manner the identity of any current or past resident and/or
family member.”
4

• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was discipline dated May 9,
2025, for sharing a youth’s picture, birthdate, and log entry
of a youth from her personal cellphone to a staff member
under investigation’s personal cell phone. Staff 2 was
trained and signed acknowledgement for Confidentially
policy on May 3, 2024.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per staff interviews and
documentation, Staff 2 provided Youth’s confidential information to
Staff 1 against agency policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
